title: How to Make No Bake Double Chocolate Chip Cookies

steps.headline: Place the sugar, cocoa, butter and milk in a small saucepan.
steps.description: Bring the mixture to a simmer over low heat, stirring until the ingredients are combined and until the butter has melted.

steps.headline: Bring the mixture to a low boil for 1 minute.
Pour the wet ingredients into a bowl.
steps.description: Add the Nutella, vanilla, and oats, folding the ingredients together with a flat plastic spatula.

steps.headline: Allow the dough to come to room temperature.
Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet.
steps.description: The cookies won’t spread much, so you can place them fairly close together on the sheet.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the cookies for 30 minutes.
Serve the cookies with a glass of cold milk.

methods.name: Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars Using Store-Bought Cookies

steps.headline: Spray an 8-1/2” x 8-1/2” glass baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
Place the cookies into the bowl of a food processor that is turned off.
steps.description: Use your hands to break the cookies into halves as you put each 1 in the food processor bowl.

steps.headline: Add the walnuts to the cookie pieces in the food processor bowl.
Pulse the cookies and the walnuts until the mixture resembles coarse bread crumbs.
Combine the cocoa powder, coffee, sugar and water in a small bowl, stirring with a whisk.
steps.description: Mix the ingredients together until the cocoa and coffee granules have formed a frosting-like texture. Add a few extra drops of water if needed.

steps.headline: Melt the marshmallows and butter in a microwave-safe bowl for 1-1/2 to 2 minutes.
steps.description: When the marshmallows are puffy, then you’ll know the mixture is ready.

steps.headline: Fold the cocoa powder mixture into the melted marshmallows using a flat plastic spatula.
Fold the wet ingredients into the chopped cookies and walnuts.
Spread the dough into the baking pan.
Refrigerate the cookies for 15 minutes.
Remove the cookies from the refrigerator.
steps.description: Cut them into 12 squares and serve them.

methods.name: Vegan No-Bake Double Chocolate Chip Cookies

steps.headline: Line an 8-1/2” by 8-1/2” square pan with parchment paper.
steps.description: The parchment paper should spill over the edges of the pan.

steps.headline: Pulse the almonds in a food processor fitted with a steel blade.
steps.description: When you are finished, the almonds should resemble coarse breadcrumbs.

steps.headline: Add the dark chocolate chips and the flaxseed meal to the chopped almonds.
steps.description: Pulse the ingredients until the mixture is finely chopped.

steps.headline: Scoop the almond, chocolate chip and flaxseed mixture into a bowl using a flat plastic spatula and set it aside.
Combine the prunes, honey, peanut butter and cocoa powder in the bowl of the food processor.
steps.description: Process the mixture until all of the prunes are finely chopped and the mixture comes together as a paste.

steps.headline: Add the almond, chocolate chip and flaxseed mixture to the prune paste.
Pulse the mixture for a few seconds until everything comes together.
Press the mixture evenly into the square pan lined with parchment paper.
steps.description: Fold the excess paper over the mixture and cover it with a plate.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the mixture for 2 hours.
Take the dish out of the refrigerator and remove the block bar from the dish by pulling up the sides of the parchment paper.
steps.description: The whole thing should slip out easily.

steps.headline: Gently peel away the parchment paper and set the block on a clean cutting board.
Slice the block into 14 cookie bars using a chef’s knife.
Wrap each cookie bar in wax paper and place each bar in the refrigerator.

text: Chocolate Chip Cookies Place the sugar, cocoa, butter and milk in a small saucepan. Bring the mixture to a simmer over low heat, stirring until the ingredients are combined and until the butter has melted. Bring the mixture to a low boil for 1 minute.  Pour the wet ingredients into a bowl. Add the Nutella, vanilla, and oats, folding the ingredients together with a flat plastic spatula. Allow the dough to come to room temperature. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet. The cookies won’t spread much, so you can place them fairly close together on the sheet. Refrigerate the cookies for 30 minutes.  Serve the cookies with a glass of cold milk.  Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars Using Store-Bought Cookies Spray an 8-1/2” x 8-1/2” glass baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.  Place the cookies into the bowl of a food processor that is turned off. Use your hands to break the cookies into halves as you put each 1 in the food processor bowl. Add the walnuts to the cookie pieces in the food processor bowl.  Pulse the cookies and the walnuts until the mixture resembles coarse bread crumbs.  Combine the cocoa powder, coffee, sugar and water in a small bowl, stirring with a whisk. Mix the ingredients together until the cocoa and coffee granules have formed a frosting-like texture. Add a few extra drops of water if needed. Melt the marshmallows and butter in a microwave-safe bowl for 1-1/2 to 2 minutes. When the marshmallows are puffy, then you’ll know the mixture is ready. Fold the cocoa powder mixture into the melted marshmallows using a flat plastic spatula.  Fold the wet ingredients into the chopped cookies and walnuts.  Spread the dough into the baking pan.  Refrigerate the cookies for 15 minutes.  Remove the cookies from the refrigerator. Cut them into 12 squares and serve them. Vegan No-Bake Double Chocolate Chip Cookies Line an 8-1/2” by 8-1/2” square pan with parchment paper. The parchment paper should spill over the edges of the pan. Pulse the almonds in a food processor fitted with a steel blade. When you are finished, the almonds should resemble coarse breadcrumbs. Add the dark chocolate chips and the flaxseed meal to the chopped almonds. Pulse the ingredients until the mixture is finely chopped. Scoop the almond, chocolate chip and flaxseed mixture into a bowl using a flat plastic spatula and set it aside.  Combine the prunes, honey, peanut butter and cocoa powder in the bowl of the food processor. Process the mixture until all of the prunes are finely chopped and the mixture comes together as a paste. Add the almond, chocolate chip and flaxseed mixture to the prune paste.  Pulse the mixture for a few seconds until everything comes together.  Press the mixture evenly into the square pan lined with parchment paper. Fold the excess paper over the mixture and cover it with a plate. Refrigerate the mixture for 2 hours.  Take the dish out of the refrigerator and remove the block bar from the dish by pulling up the sides of the parchment paper. The whole thing should slip out easily. Gently peel away the parchment paper and set the block on a clean cutting board.  Slice the block into 14 cookie bars using a chef’s knife.  Wrap each cookie bar in wax paper and place each bar in the refrigerator.
